revisionRefs.description: A plugin for the Apache Felix Webconsole. When installed, this bundle will add a tab on the Web Console that provides a graphic overview of the OSGi framework, including services, bundles, and components. Colors are used to encode the different states. Bundles are shown to be started, stopped, starting, resolved, and installed. Services are shown to be used, looked for, or registered in the air. Components can be seen to be operating or not satisfied. Most objects have a tooltip with extra information and all objects can be clicked upon. Hovering over a bundle or service shows only the conenections to/from the component. The display updates every 5 seconds to provide a continuous view on the operations of the framework it runs on.
revisionRefs.name: aQute.xray.plugin

revisionRefs.description: Contains only the annotations for bnd.
revisionRefs.name: bnd Annotations Library

revisionRefs.description: User Administration Service

revisionRefs.description: An Authenticator service that uses UserAdmin and a hash to authenticate a user.A strong hash with configurable salt and iteration is stored in the credentials of the User. Additionally, the authenticator provides a number of commands to create users and set passwords.
revisionRefs.name: osgi.authenticator.provider

revisionRefs.description: An Authority service that uses UserAdmin to provide the permissions.
revisionRefs.name: osgi.authorization.provider

revisionRefs.description: Provides a java.util.Timer and java.util.concurrent.Executor service.Sharing timers and executors can make the overall system more performant and reduce memory consumption. Since these services are based on JRE classes/interfaces this bundle has no additional dependencies.
revisionRefs.name: osgi.base.provider

revisionRefs.description: This component is an extender that reads the /configuration/configuration.json file and installs the list of maps in there as configuration. The configurer supports a number of features like profiles, macro expansion, binary resource handling, and configuration through system properties. See the readme.md file for more details.
revisionRefs.name: osgi.configurer.provider

revisionRefs.description: enRoute is an OSGi project that creates a runtime environment for developing applications. This bundle provides the base API for this environment. In any enRoute 1.0.0.201403221410 environment you will find implementations for all the contained services. The purpose of this bundle is to be use for compilation, it must not be used in a runtime; in general, providers must carry their service packages.
revisionRefs.name: osgi.enroute.base.api

revisionRefs.description: A bundle providing support for OSGi testing. This bundle contains JUnit 4, Mockito and support for OSGi testing based on bnd. The purpose of this bundle is to be used on the test path. For a launcher, it should be included on the launch class path. With the bnd launcher, this exports should be added to the system packages.
revisionRefs.name: osgi.enroute.testing.support
